Five years have passed since the Great East Japan Earthquake that occurred on March 11, 2011. I am deeply sorry if I think of the desperation of those who passed away due to the earthquake and the deep sorrow of the bereaved families who lost their beloved caretaker, I will not bear mercy.

We pray for the repose of those who were sacrificed again, and those who have been forced to leave their hometown due to the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant accident, and those who are inconvenienced even if they return to their hometown I express my sincere condolences to all the victims, including them.

At the same time, On 9th, the Otsu District Court issued a provisional disposition decision of injunction injunction of Takahama nuclear reactors 3, 4 in Fukui prefecture. This means that it is the first time to stop the operation of nuclear power plants in operation and that judicial judgment is extremely justified that it can not be safe against the new standards of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission.

Although the direct victims of the Fukuichi accident are obvious, it is a fact that many citizens have anxiety and disbelief with respect to the safety and restarting of nuclear power plants in the earthquake country / volcano country Japan . The government should listen to the public's opinions as soon as possible, stop nuclear power plants from restarting operations, and make a major shift in energy policies.

I overtook Francisco Morato, Franco da Rocha, Mariporã, Caieiras where there were landslides and floods, caused by the last rains.

Unfortunately 20 people have died and there are still 5 people missing.
In Franco da Rocha I met with mayors, the gov of SP, ministers, federal, state and municipal civil defense officers and parliamentarians.
I reaffirmed the federal government's support for the municipalities.
Our policy of prevention and coping with disasters combines prevention and warning to avoid deaths (...)
(...) with emergency actions of support to the homeless and rescue of victims and reconstruction.
Concrete actions: liberation of the FGTS for the affected populations and priority in #MinhaCasaMinhaVida.
Several homes in #MinhaCasaMinhaVida are under construction in the region.
At #MinhaCasaMinhaVida we give priority to the care of families who live in homelessness or who live in risky areas.
